title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 9, 2019).

Trump's decision to suspend talks with the Taliban stemmed from ambivalence within his administration and growing bipartisan opposition toward an emerging deal to withdraw U.S. troops from Afghanistan.

The Air Force said there was nothing improper about a crew's March stay at a Trump resort, but said it was continuing to review details of the trip.

The appointment of a Saudi royal as the kingdom's new oil minister tightens the crown prince's grip on the economy.

Iran said it had accelerated its nuclear-research work and threatened to take fresh steps that could allow it to expand its stockpile of enriched uranium.

Russia and Ukraine conducted a large-scale prisoner swap, a potential first step toward easing tensions between Moscow and Kiev.

A landmark 2018 natural-gas deal between Israel and Egypt faces legal challenges and concerns about security threats from Islamic State.

Pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong made a direct appeal to the U.S. for support in a peaceful rally.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 09, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
